results.title: Five go down to the sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
While on a cycling holiday in Cornwall, the Five hear how in the past, pirates used to set up a light on stormy nights on the Tremannon coast to wreck ships. The children investigate the cove at night and find that there are still mysterious lights and some sinister goings-on.

results.title: Five are together again. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
With Quentin Kirrin and his wife in quarantine for scarlet fever, the children are sent to stay with Professor Hayling and his son, Tinker. An exciting adventure begins when a circus comes to town and some ‘top secret’ notes disappear from the Professor’s study.

results.title: Five run away together. Five have a wonderful time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
In “Five run away together”, the children run away from Kirrin Cottage, when the bad Mrs. Stick, who is looking after them for a week, threatens to lock Timmy in the shed. They escape to Kirrin Island, where all is not as it should be. “Five have a wonderful time” introduces us to a snake-charmer called Miss Slither, and a fire-eater called Alfredo. While on their caravanning holiday, the children find that they must enlist the help of these new friends when they uncover a mystery at nearby Faynight’s Castle.

results.title: Flash William
results.creator_credit: John Laing, Thom Burstyn, Michael McKennirey, Arthur Hammond and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Flash William Shewchuck is a one-man movie industry. He combines the roles of film producer, director, camera man, actor, promoter, projectionist and ticket taker. In between productions, he works elsewhere to finance his company. In this film about his latest feature, “Dawson City Joe”, he reveals his style and technique. Some of his innovations, developed by Flash in the isolation of the wilderness, have long been used in the industry. Voice and narration by Stanley Jackson.

results.title: Flash Gordon. Vol. 02
results.brief_description: Episodes 7 to 13 of this cult movie serial. Episode 7: “Shattering Doom”: In this episode, Flash is tortured and Dale is forced to betray him. He is sent back to the atom furnaces with the order that high voltage wire be connected to his wrist. Episode 8: “Tournament of Death”: Ming arrives in Vultan’s kingdom and Flash fights to earn his freedom in combat with a masked gladiator and a huge orangopoid. Episode 9: “Fighting the Fire Dragon”: Conspiring with Princess Aura, the High Priest gives Flash drops of forgetfulness and has him sent through the Tunnel of Terror to the abode of the sacred Fire Dragon. Episode 10: “The Unseen Peril”: Brought before Ming to choose his bride and unable to remember Dale, Flash goes off with Aura, but is rescued by Zarkov, Dale and Barin. Episode 11: “In the Claws of the Tigron”: Using Zarkov’s invisibility machine Flash releases Vultan from his dungeon prison and rushes to rescue Dale from the claws of the vicious tigron. Episode 12: “Trapped in the Turret”: In this episode Vultan invites Flash and his friends to visit his sky city. Episode 13: “Rocketing to Earth”: In the thirteenth and final episode Flash and his friends take refuge in Zharkov’s laboratory and prepare to leave Mongo for earth.

results.title: Flash Gordon. Vol. 01
results.brief_description: Episodes one to six of this cult movie serial. Episode 1: “The Planet of peril”. Flash (Larry “Buster” Crabbe), Dale Arden (Jean Rogers) and Dr. Zarkov (Frank Shannon) are captured by Ming the Merciless (Charles Middleton) ruler of the planet, Mongo. Bent on galactic conquest, Ming stops at nothing in his attempt to destroy the Earth. Zarkov is forced to work in Ming’s lab and Flash finds himself wrestling with three fanged men. Episode 2: “The Tunnel of terror”. Dale is subjected to Ming’s “dehumanizer” in order to marry her. Thun of the Lion-Men joins forces with Flash and together they sneak into the Palace and find Zarkov. Flash races to save Dale only to be confronted with the Fire Dragon. Episode 3: “Captured by sharkmen”. After falling through a trap door, Flash and Dale land in an underground river and are taken prisoner by the Sharkmen. Betrayed by their ruler, Kala, Flash becomes entombed in a flooding tank - occupied by Octosak. Episode 4: “Battling the sea beast”. Aura and Thun arrive just in time to save Flash with their ray guns but the underwater city’s controls are destroyed and water starts to flood in. Episode 5: “The Destroying ray”. Using a ray to counteract the magnetic power that holds Kala’s Shark Palace underwater, Ming raises the underwater city to the surface. Enter Prince Barin, true ruler of Mongo who befriends Zarkov. Together they head off to rescue Flash, only to encounter the evil Hawk Men. Episode 6: “Flaming torture”. Flash soon discovers that the planet Mongo is a melting pot of evil leaders when he’s taken prisoner by yet another: Vultan. Flash faces execution in the dreaded “Static Room”…

results.title: Flames of love on the ice
results.creator_credit: Beijing Salon Films and Deng Yuan
results.brief_description:
Roller skating expert Lin Jia Jun is involved in a traffic accident which forces him into prison as a result of killing a Hong Kong traveller. Soon after coming out of prison and returning to his garage, he encounters the dead traveller’s widow Zhao Ya Yi. The two of them develop from misunderstanding to affectionate feelings towards each other. However, Lin Jia Jun fails to realize that the traveller was an important member of the Hong Kong Mafia, who before passing away hid a stash of drugs which triggered his Hong Kong associates into hiring a professional killer to deal with the business in the Mainland. He attacks during Lin and Zhao Ya Yi’s wedding, and in the crossfire Zhao Ya Yi is brutally murdered, and Lin Jia Jin decides to help the Mainland police as they have been keeping the Mafia gang under surveillance. As soon as the Mafia gang shatters into Lin’s garage Lin Jia Jun, disregarding his own safety, takes the gang on, until the Mainland police make their entrance from the roof and annihilate the gang.
(Awards: Golden Rooster 1991 - Editing).
(Wendy Xu, 2014).

results.title: Recontre
results.creator_credit: Laurent Coderre, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cardboard cutouts explode, twirl, disintegrate and form shapes in a delightful, airy film that describes man’s initiation to life, his journey through it, with its inevitable ups and downs, and his final triumph as the person he struggled to become. Music by Sharon Smith.

results.title: Five steps to better farm living
results.creator_credit: Evelyn Cherry and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Agricultural economist R.R. Hare discusses the importance of a good farm management. Profitable farming depends upon effective land use, good livestock management, effective use of labor, efficient use of capital and optimum business size. Victory Bonds are recommended as a way of saving money to make farm improvements following the end of World War II.
